intro: Hieracium chaetothyrsum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium chaetothyrsum is often found in temperate regions and can be an indicator of soil disturbance or ecological change.
